comments:
I've just started using mylar. I noticed the following error appear. 
I am connecting to an authenticated Trac site. I have had the query open fine in the task window for may 30 minutes now.

[[ Oh, I had to create an account to submit the bug. ]]

-- Error Log --
Date: Tue May 01 10:33:27 EDT 2007
Message: An internal error occurred during: "Synchronizing queries: trac".
Severity: Error
Plugin ID: org.eclipse.core.jobs
Stack Trace:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException:
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isLegal(Assert.java:62)
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isLegal(Assert.java:46)
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Status.setMessage(Status.java:178)
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Status.<init>(Status.java:85)
at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.trac.core.TracStatus.<init>(TracStatus.java:33)
at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.trac.core.TracCorePlugin.toStatus(TracCorePlugin.java:93)
at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.trac.core.TracRepositoryConnector.performQuery(TracRepositoryConnector.java:148)
at org.eclipse.mylar.tasks.ui.SynchronizeQueryJob.run(SynchronizeQueryJob.java:92)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
The error is caused by Eclipse 3.2 not allowing null as a message. TracStatus needs to catch that.
The status API has been refactored in bug 170536 which resolves this bug.
